org.jpws.front

Class PwsFileContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.data.PwsFileSocket
      • org.jpws.front.PwsFileContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, OptionChangeListener, ActivitySource, org.jpws.pwslib.order.OrderedListListener

    public class PwsFileContainer
extends PwsFileSocket
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, org.jpws.pwslib.order.OrderedListListener, OptionChangeListener, ActivitySource
    A containment structure to deal with GUI handling of a loaded PwsFile database. It is an extention of PwsFileSocket, which is the backend adapter for datafiles into the multi-threaded application environment.

    This class dispatches events of type ChangeEvent. The static member class of this class or the Java class javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent can be used to receive events. Only the member class, however, allows to identify the type of property or event that has changed on the container. The Java interface javax.swing.event.ChangeListener is used for listeners. There are seven event types dispatched from this class:
    MODIFY_EVENT : dispatched on each modification of the content or definition of the database; also dispatched when the file becomes "unmodified" (e.g. save performed)
    FILTER_MODE : dispatched when property "getFilterStatus()" changes to a new state
    OPERATION_MODE : dispatched when property "getOperationMode()" changes to a new state
    DISPLAY_MODE : dispatched when property "getViewType()" changes to a new state
    SELECTION_EVENT : dispatched on each selection event occurring in the GUI record listing interface
    SELECTION_STATUS : dispatched when property "getSelectionStatus()" changes to a new state
    As a general rule, all event types are initially dispatched upon registration of a listener. PwsFileSocket

      • saveCopy

        public void saveCopy(boolean backup)
        Dialog intensive function to create a copy of the PwsFile of this container to a user selectable output file with an optional user definable passphrase. The PwsFile of this container is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        backup - whether a backup copy is to be performed

      • saveAs

        public boolean saveAs()
        Makes a copy of the PwsFile of this container to a user selectable output file. The PwsFile of this container keeps its original filepath only under the circumstance that the process was broken by the user. Otherwise any chosen output file will remain active.

      • saveFile

        public boolean saveFile(boolean confirm)
        Saves the PwsFile of this container. GUI-active.
        Parameters:
        confirm - boolean if true a positive operation success will be reported to the user in case a file-write operation was performed
        Returns:
        true if and only if the file is regularly saved or void (closed) after this routine terminates

        Dialog active function to let the user modify the access passphrase for the Pws database of this container.

      • deleteCommand

        Performs a delete command; discriminates between entry selection and group selection within the list display.

      • deleteGroupDlg

        public void deleteGroupDlg(java.lang.String group)
        Performs a dialog to delete a group of file entries. This function works independently from display selection (but may get called in consequence of a selection). It currently does not operate when a display filter is set.
        Parameters:
        group - String, a PWS normalized GROUP value

        group - String name of group indicating group-delete occurred, may be null

      • importSelectedFrom

                               boolean copy)

        Parameters:
        source -

      • mergeDatabase

        public org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecordList mergeDatabase(java.awt.Dialog parent,
                                                        org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecordList list,
                                                        java.lang.String source,
                                                        java.lang.String target,
                                                        int initialConflictModus,
                                                        boolean allowInvalids)
        Performs dialog to incorporate a set of PwsRecords, contained in the parameter record list, into this database. A conflict solving strategy may be specified in the modus parameter, which comes into effect when a record of the parameter list shares an identity within this file but has a different data signature.

        This method includes GUI action as e.g. undoable edit update! The third parameter gives a description (name) of the source which may be displayed to represent the merge event.

        Records incorporated through this method will be marked as IMPORTED for the lifetime of this container instance.

        Parameters:
        parent - Dialog parent dialog or null for mainframe
        list - PwsRecordList list of import records
        source - String a human readable name for the input source
        target - String optional target GROUP name for merged records (may be null)
        initialConflictModus - int initial conflict solving strategy (one from PwsRecordList.MERGE_* constants)
        allowInvalids - boolean determines whether invalid records of the source are excluded (=false) or considered candidates for inclusion (=true)
        Returns:
        PwsRecordList containing records which were NOT MERGED due to conflict or null if this function was broken since 0-5-0

      • mergeDatabase

        public void mergeDatabase()
        Top level function and dialog to perform incorporation of another PwsFile into this database. The user may select a file from file chooser and receives modified feedback whether all, none or a part of a selected file can be imported.

      • convert

        public void convert()
        Sets a newer file format for the persistent state of this file if and only if its current format is an old format (V1, V2). Runs on any thread.
        Since:
        0-4-0

      • isIOProgressing

        public boolean isIOProgressing()
        Whether there is an IO function active for this container. This will be true when a user dialog is running in the context of a IO function (even when no critical phase is yet activated for the file).
        Returns:
        true if and only if some thread is performing an IO function of this container which currently does or is expected to affect the state of the persistent file

      • isRecordEditing

        Whether there is currently a record editor active on this database.
        Returns:
        boolean true == record is being edited

      • close

        public boolean close()
        Attempts to close this container for operations. Saves the PwsFile of this container if modified. The attempt is broken if there exists a critical phase for this file or the user chooses to cancel a confirm dialog or save operation fails. After successful save, the display facilities for this container are removed and the container is CLOSED.
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if the file has been closed

      • close

        public boolean close(int modus)
        Attempts to close this container for operations. Saves the PwsFile of this container if modified. The attempt is broken if there exists a critical phase for this file or the user chooses to cancel a confirm dialog or save operation fails. After successful save, the display facilities for this container are removed and the container is CLOSED.
        Parameters:
        modus - int 0 = single operation, 1 = multi-close operation
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if the file has been closed

      • getSelectedRecord

        public org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecord getSelectedRecord()
        Returns the PwsRecord associated to the currently selected display row, if and only if this row qualifies to point to a record. Otherwise, if display is disabled or if there is nothing selected, null is returned instead. If more than one records are selected, the first sorted is returned.

      • getSelectedRecords

        public org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] getSelectedRecords()
        Returns an array with the currently selected records of this container. The array is empty if nothing is selected.

      • getSelectedGroupName

        public java.lang.String getSelectedGroupName()
        Returns the GROUP value that may be identified through the currently selected display row (regardless if it is a folder or a leaf node). If there is no GROUP value defined or nothing is selected, null is returned.

      • getSelectedGroupRecords

      • toggleFilter

        public void toggleFilter(int filter)
        Toggles filter status of this file container between FILTER_OFF and the given filtering type.

        In other words: if the current filter modus is the given modus, then the modus is set to FILTER_OFF, otherwise it is set to the given modus.

        Parameters:
        filter - int filter mode

      • getMirrorFileDef

        protected org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile getMirrorFileDef()
                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a unique file definition for the mirror file of this container. This definition is based on the filepath feature of the database and should return same results as long as the filepath hasn't changed. If a database has no filepath, a random temporary file is returned. (NOTE: This renders a definition for a file. It does not imply this file already exists!)
        Parameters:
        ContextFile - mirror file definition of container
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • controlMirrors

        public void controlMirrors()
        This method checks whether a mirror of this database is present in the JPWS mirror directory. If so, it moves the mirror file into a special directory for this database and informs the user accordingly. Requires to run on EDT!

      • removeMirrorFile

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent arg)
        This action handler is added to components which are element of or triggered off by this file container. It reacts to buttons pressed for specific purposes that must be dealt with within the container or the ESC key pressed.

        It currently listens to AddDialog (record editor), the Quickfind bar and the ContainerView (for ESC button).
